intro: Onosma asperrima var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf onosma, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. It is characterized by its hairy stems and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. This variety is noted for its hardiness and is occasionally cultivated for ornamental purposes.
